title: SEBI ‘warning’ letter on social media to Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal: You have failed to … - The Times of India
summary:
SEBI Cautions Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal Over Social Media Conduct

Publication Date: October 23, 2023 | Source: Economic Times

In a recent communication, the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has issued a warning letter to Ola's CEO, Bhavish Aggarwal, citing concerns over his activities on social media which may be in violation of securities laws.

  • The warning highlights specific posts made by Aggarwal that could mislead investors.
  • SEBI emphasizes the importance of transparency and ethical conduct in financial communications.
  • This comes amid increased scrutiny of leaders in the tech industry regarding their public statements.
"We expect all market participants to adhere strictly to disclosure norms and avoid any statements that could mislead stakeholders," stated a SEBI official.

This warning serves as a reminder of the regulatory obligations that CEOs have towards their public communications, especially in volatile markets.
newTitle: SEBI Cautions Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal Over Social Media Conduct

Mark Zuckerberg made headlines after he was seen wearing a luxurious watch valued at approximately ₹7.7 crore during a Facebook video announcement about a policy overhaul at Meta.

  • Zuckerberg's watch, a Greubel Forsey ‘Hand Made 1’, is extremely rare, with only two or three made each year.
  • His video announcement included the controversial decision to eliminate third-party fact-checkers from Meta's platforms.
  • The watch's cost sparked social media discussions, with many commenting on its value exceeding that of a typical house.
  • Notable reactions on social media included comments on the cultural disconnect of wearing such an expensive item while discussing community issues.
“Zuck was wearing a ~$1M watch in his community notes announcement video. Nothing says I understand the culture shift of the community more than a watch that costs more than most people's houses.”

This incident highlights the attention and discussions surrounding celebrity choices and their disconnect with everyday experiences.

title: SEBI warns Ola Electric over disclosures via social media ahead of exchange filings, seeks corrective action | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
SEBI Issues Warning to Ola Electric Over Premature Social Media Disclosures

Date: January 8, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

Markets regulator SEBI has warned Ola Electric regarding violation of disclosure regulations due to a social media announcement made before official exchange filings.

  • SEBI warned Ola Electric for announcing corporate plans on social media before filing with stock exchanges.
  • Chairman Bhavish Aggarwal disclosed plans for expansion on social media hours before notifying stock exchanges.
  • The warning, issued on January 7, 2025, cites violations of SEBI regulations regarding equal access to information for investors.
  • Ola Electric has been advised to improve compliance standards and take corrective actions.
“By failing to first disseminate the information on the stock exchanges, you have failed to provide equal and timely access to information for all investors.” - SEBI Warning Letter

The warning emphasizes the need for compliance with regulations to avoid future enforcement actions from SEBI.
newTitle: SEBI Issues Warning to Ola Electric Over Premature Social Media Disclosures

title: Getty Images, Shutterstock gear up for AI challenge with $3.7 billion merger - Reuters
summary:
Getty Images and Shutterstock Merge in $3.7 Billion Deal to Face AI Challenges

Date: January 7, 2023 | Source: Reuters

The merger between Getty Images and Shutterstock aims to create a powerhouse in the stock-image industry, valued at $3.7 billion, to adapt to challenges posed by artificial intelligence technology.

  • Getty Images is merging with rival Shutterstock to combat challenges from growing AI tools.
  • The deal is notable for its potential antitrust scrutiny from regulators.
  • Shutterstock shareholders will have several options in the merger, including cash or stock from Getty.
  • The combined company will lead with nearly $2 billion in annual revenues.
  • Getty’s CEO Craig Peters expresses confidence in securing antitrust approval.
  • The merger may yield up to $200 million in cost savings within three years.
"We don't control the timing of (the approval), but we have a high confidence. This has been a situation where customers have not had choice. They've always had choice," said Craig Peters.

This merger reflects an adaptive strategy in response to new technological threats in the visual content industry and highlights the evolving landscape with AI integration.
newTitle: Getty Images and Shutterstock Merge in $3.7 Billion Deal to Face AI Challenges

title: ExplainSpeaking: What the latest GDP estimates tell about the state of India’s economy - The Indian Express
summary:
ExplainSpeaking: What the latest GDP estimates tell about the state of India’s economy

Publication Date: January 2025
Source: Indian Express

The Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation (MoSPI) has released the First Advance Estimates (FAEs) of India’s GDP growth for the financial year 2024-25. These estimates suggest that India's nominal GDP is projected to reach Rs 324 lakh crores, growing 9.7% over the previous financial year.

  • The estimated nominal GDP for FY25 is $3.8 trillion at the exchange rate of 85 rupees to a dollar.
  • Real GDP is expected to be Rs 184.9 lakh crores, accounting for 57% of nominal GDP, indicating a growth deceleration.
  • Private consumption demand (PFCE) plays a crucial role, contributing almost 60% to GDP.
  • Government spending growth has been slow, averaging just 4.2% for the current year.
  • Investments have stalled since 2014, leading to reduced productive capacity growth.
"When one considers a slightly longer period, it becomes clear that India’s real economy is growing at less than 5% per annum."

The latest GDP figures serve as a reality check, revealing that while India's growth appears strong, much of this is boosted by a low base effect from the pandemic's economic contraction.
newTitle: India's Economic Outlook: Insights from the Latest GDP Estimates

title: Billion-dollar potential: Haldiram's snack empire attracts global interest - Business Standard
summary:
Billion-dollar potential: Haldiram's snack empire attracts global interest

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Reuters

The Agrwal family has initiated the process of selling a portion of Haldiram’s, a major player in the Indian savoury snack market, amidst growing interest from global private equity investors.

  • Haldiram's is negotiating to sell a fifth of the company at a valuation of $10 billion.
  • Previous discussions with firms like PepsiCo and Kellogg’s point to sustained investor interest.
  • Tata Consumer Products considered acquiring a 51% stake but hesitated due to the high valuation.
  • The company has a rich history dating back to 1937 in Bikaner, founded by Ganga Bishan Agrawal.
  • Court battles among family members for brand usage rights have been ongoing since 1991.
  • Market projections indicate the ethnic snacks sector could grow significantly from Rs 10,800 crore to Rs 19,500 crore by 2025-26.
“The Delhi and Kolkata families have been warring in court since 1991 to establish who has the actual right to use the Haldiram Bhujiawala and Haldiram’s brand in Delhi.”

The ongoing negotiations and market potential of Haldiram’s suggest a promising future for the popular snack brand as it navigates investor interest and legal challenges.
newTitle: Haldiram's Snack Empire Attracts Global Investors

"A stronger position for gold can be expected if patterns become clearer amid the ongoing economic tensions."

The article emphasizes the uncertainty in financial markets and the pivotal role of gold as a hedge against inflation in turbulent economic times.
newTitle: Gold Prices Rise Amid US Economic Concerns

title: Tata Steel Q3 update: India steel production rises 6% YoY to 5.68 million tonnes - The Economic Times
summary:
Tata Steel Q3 update: India steel production rises 6% YoY to 5.68 million tonnes

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Economic Times

Tata Steel India has reported a 6% year-on-year and an 8% sequential rise in crude steel production, reaching 5.68 million tonnes in Q3FY25, primarily driven by the expansion at Kalinganagar. Deliveries also hit a record high of 5.29 million tonnes.

  • Crude steel production increased due to the commissioning of a new blast furnace.
  • Deliveries marked the best ever Q3 sales performance, supported by both domestic and export markets.
  • Significant growth observed in various verticals, especially in branded products and e-commerce revenues.
  • Year-to-date production for 9MFY25 rose 5% to 16.2 million tonnes.
"Growth has been consistently aided by various strategic initiatives to enhance consumer experience," the company filing stated.

Overall, Tata Steel's strong performance in Q3 positions the company well for future growth amidst ongoing market demand.
newTitle: Tata Steel Reports 6% Increase in Q3 Steel Production

title: Tata Steel Q3 Update: India production rises 6%, deliveries at record levels - CNBCTV18
summary:
Tata Steel Q3 Update: India production rises 6%, deliveries at record levels

Date: January 7, 2024
Source: CNBC TV18

Tata Steel reported a significant increase in India's crude steel production for Q3FY25, with deliveries reaching record levels driven by strong domestic sales and exports.

  • India's crude steel production increased by 6.17% YoY to 5.68 MT for Q3FY25.
  • Deliveries in India reached a record 5.29 MT, up 8.4% YoY.
  • Tata Steel Netherlands saw 1.76 MT of liquid steel production, with 1.53 MT in deliveries, marking a 16% YoY growth.
  • Tata Steel UK faced production standstill at zero due to the blast furnace closures, with deliveries down 12.5% YoY.
“Tata Steel India deliveries were the ‘best ever 3Q’ sales at 5.29 million tons,” the company stated.

The significant growth in production and deliveries showcases Tata Steel's robust performance in India, establishing a strong position in both domestic and export markets.
newTitle: Tata Steel Q3 Update: India production rises 6%, deliveries at record levels

title: Mahindra XEV 9e, BE 6 top variant prices announced; Check battery range, features, booking dates here - The Economic Times
summary:
Mahindra XEV 9e, BE 6 top variant prices announced; Check battery range, features, booking dates here

Date: Tuesday
Source: Economic Times

Introduction

Mahindra and Mahindra has unveiled the prices for its electric SUVs, the Mahindra XEV 9e and BE 6, with various options and features designed for consumers eager for electric vehicle options.

Key Points

  • The Mahindra XEV 9e is priced at Rs 30.90 lakh for the top variant with a 79 kWh battery.
  • The BE 6 top-spec variant will retail at Rs 26.9 lakh.
  • Bookings for both SUVs will commence on February 14, with test drives starting January 14.
  • Deliveries of the XEV 9e will begin in March 2025, while the BE 6 deliveries are expected in early March.
  • The XEV 9e features two battery options (59kWh and 79kWh) and claims a range of 656km on the MIDC cycle.
  • Both models come equipped with advanced technology like a three-screen setup, augmented reality head-up displays, and a comprehensive ADAS suite.

Notable Quotes or Statistics

“The 79kWh battery can be charged from 20 to 80 percent in 20 minutes using a 175kW DC fast charger.”

Conclusion

Mahindra’s new electric SUVs promise exciting features and competitive pricing, catering to the growing market for electric vehicles in India.
